sentences.english: Her Cupid-bow mouth pouted to give him an airy kiss.
sentences.chinese: 她那丘比特型的嘴一撅，像是要給他送一個飛吻。

sentences.english: I do so, father, and I send him my Soul with it!
sentences.chinese: 我要飛吻，父親，我把靈魂也一起飛給他。

sentences.english: I gave my biggest smile and blew her a kiss.
sentences.chinese: 我還對她開懷大笑，並給她了她一個飛吻。

sentences.english: Give an air kiss to the person on your opposite.
sentences.chinese: 給坐在撲面的人一個飛吻。

sentences.english: He flew me a kiss when I said hello to him.
sentences.chinese: 我向他打招呼時，他給了我一個飛吻。

sentences.english: Then he blows you a kiss, gives you a little salute and walks away.
sentences.chinese: 然後他會給你一個飛吻和小小的敬禮，之後再走開。

sentences.english: She threw a kiss in Lucius' direction.
sentences.chinese: 她向盧修斯的方向送了一個飛吻。

definition: smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
fig. restless, because of fear or strong emotions
pedophile (slang, referring to the case of a Hong Kong child abductor who lured girls with the prospect of seeing "goldfish" in his apartment)
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
good omen/good luck (in business etc)/profits (gained in gambling, lottery etc)
to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
